Bogotá a city in central Colombia, is the country's capital, located on a mountain rimmed plateau high in the Cordillera Oriental of the Andes Mountains called the "Sabana de Bogotá", which is about 30 km wide and 70 km long. A high Andean Mountain range rises to the East of the city, with the downtown area resting at the foot of Monserrate and Guadalupe Mountains. Today the city is a cosmopolitan metropolis which still has some vestiges of the Spanish Colonial era. It is the political, industrial, economic and cultural center of the country.
Climate zone: Warm Temperate - Fully humid - Warm summer

Site description: Pasto, city in southwestern Colombia, capital of the department Nariño, on a plateau of the Andes Mountains. The city is just 8 km from the Galeras volcano. Volcanic activity has been frequent in the last five years, including an eruption in January 1993. The city is on the Pan-American Highway and is an important commercial and transportation center for the surrounding agricultural region.
Climate zone: Warm temperate - Dry and warm summer
